meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be codified.
meanings.sent1: Her essay lacked codifiability, making it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The codifiability of the new law allowed for easy interpretation by the public.
meanings.sent3: The codifiability of the recipe made it a breeze to follow.
meanings.sent4: The codifiability of the instructions was like a clear map guiding us through the process.
meanings.sent5: The codifiability of the data made it simple to analyze and draw conclusions.

meanings.definition: The ability to be organized or systematized into a code or set of rules.
meanings.sent1: The codifiability of the project made it easy to break down into manageable tasks.
meanings.sent2: The codifiability of the software allowed for efficient troubleshooting.
meanings.sent3: The codifiability of the game rules led to some unexpected strategies.
meanings.sent4: The codifiability of the traffic laws kept the streets safe and orderly.
meanings.sent5: The codifiability of the budget plan ensured transparency and accountability.
